intro: Dryandra floribunda, commonly known as the golden dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically shrub-like in habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
